src/lib/components/DashKaleido.tsx.description:
DashKaleido is an example component.
It takes a property, `label`, and displays it.
It renders an input with the property `value`
which is editable by the user.

label.description: A label that will be printed when this component is rendered.

value.description: The value displayed in the input.

id.description: Unique ID to identify this component in Dash callbacks.

src/lib/components/KaleidoManager.tsx.description:
KaleidoManager provides powerful layout and tab management for Dash applications.
It allows users to create, manage, and organize multiple tabs with different layouts.

style.description: Inline CSS styles to apply to the root container.

activeTab.description:
The layout ID of the currently active tab. Updates when user switches tabs.
Can be set from Python to programmatically switch to a tab with that layoutId.

activeTabData.description:
Full data object for the currently active tab, or null if a "New Tab" is active.
Contains: id (unique tab UUID), layoutId, name (display name), createdAt,
layoutParams (object with parameter values if the layout was opened with parameters).
Read-only from Python - use activeTab to switch tabs programmatically.

tabs.description:
Array of all open tabs with their full state.
Each tab object contains: id, layoutId, name, createdAt, layoutParams.
Can be set from Python to restore/manipulate tab state.

registeredLayouts.description:
Object mapping layout IDs to layout metadata.
Layouts themselves are registered via register_layout/register_layout_callback.

displayedLayouts.description: List of layout IDs to recommend when user opens "New Tab" on the client.

initialTab.description:
The layout ID to open by default when there is no persisted state.
If not specified, shows the "New Tab" layout selector.

enableStatusBar.description: If true, shows a thin status bar at the bottom of the component.

searchBarConfig.description: Configuration for the search bar behavior and appearance.

contentOverflow.description:
Controls the overflow behavior of the layout content area.
Options: 'auto', 'scroll', 'hidden', 'visible'.

maxTabs.description:
Maximum number of tabs allowed. -1 means no limit.
When the limit is reached, the + button is disabled.

persistence.description:
Used to allow user interactions to be persisted when
the component or page is refreshed.

persisted_props.description:
Properties whose user interactions will persist after refreshing.
Defaults to ['activeTab', 'tabs'].

persistence_type.description:
Where persisted user changes will be stored:
'memory', 'local', or 'session'.

loading_state.description: Object that holds the loading state object coming from dash-renderer.

children.description: The content to render for the active tab.

tabsData.description:
Array of tab data for tabs that have a layout selected.
Used to trigger the Python callback that renders all tab contents.

id.description: Unique ID to identify this component in Dash callbacks.

src/lib/components/KaleidoTab.tsx.description:
KaleidoTab is a container for tab content within KaleidoManager.
Each tab's content is wrapped in a KaleidoTab component which handles
visibility toggling based on the active tab.

children.description: The content to render inside this tab.

style.description: Inline styles to apply to the tab container.

loading_state.description: Object that holds the loading state object coming from dash-renderer.

type.name: union

value.name: shape

is_loading.description: Determines if the component is loading or not
is_loading.name: any

component_name.description: Holds the name of the component that is loading
component_name.name: union

value.raw: { is_loading?: boolean | undefined; prop_name?: string | undefined; component_name?: string | undefined; }

type.raw: { is_loading?: boolean | undefined; prop_name?: string | undefined; component_name?: string | undefined; } | undefined

id.description: Unique ID to identify this component in Dash callbacks.
